meanings.definition: To persuade someone to do something or give you something by saying nice things
meanings.sent1: She tried to wheedle her brother into sharing his toys by complimenting him.
meanings.sent2: The salesman tried to wheedle the customer into buying the expensive watch.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to wheedle its way into getting extra treats by purring loudly.
meanings.sent4: The politician was skilled at wheedling votes from undecided voters.
meanings.sent5: The child's innocent smile was used to wheedle her way out of trouble.

meanings.definition: To influence or entice someone by using flattery or charm
meanings.sent1: He managed to wheedle his boss into giving him a raise with his smooth talk.
meanings.sent2: The actress was able to wheedle her way into the exclusive party.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tried to wheedle its owner into giving it more belly rubs.
meanings.sent4: The con artist wheedled his victims out of their life savings.
meanings.sent5: Her sweet voice was used to wheedle the audience into giving her a standing ovation.
